author: {'steamid': '76561198811517938', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1705354102}
review: Really challenging and fun with retro styling, modern features. Thankful for the remap so can play with an arcade stick more easily. I wish i could figure out how to reset auto hacking terminals to manual.
developer_response: Thank you for your feedback. You can disable auto-hacking and assign new Gon tasks in Neon City. There are special terminals in the upper area near the first elevator when entering the City.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052682027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1698092718}
review:

Viele verschiedene Waffen, Skills, R√ºstung, Baupl√§ne etc. Story, Sound und episch Bossfights √ºberzeugen auch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025158834', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1697486928}
review: The controls are barely functional and enemies deal a truly ridiculous amount of damage. I jumped off ledges and insta-died at least ten times in a row in the third area. You can't pan with the camera to see what's below you, so lots of blind jumping into the abyss. You also lose all progress since the last save when you die. Concepts are poorly explained and virtually nothing is marked or labeled either on the map in the world. The atmosphere is amazing and the graphics are beautiful, but this is pretty half-baked and completely unpolished. At a bare minimum the controls need to be more refined (the dash in particular is completely out of control) and save points and other important landmarks need to be marked somehow.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968658621', 'num_games_owned': 997, 'num_reviews': 461, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1693445675}
review: Difficult to grasp and very busy to look at.  There [i]might[/i] be a decent game in there for someone with a lot of patience and tolerance, but I was unable to get past this to give it a fair shake.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978869580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1693004757}
review: Game is cool.  Unique mechanics from what I can see. I play quite a bit of metroidvania type games but not all of them capture me to finish.  So far I'm juggling a few different games because of my backlog but the pixel art is good, the mechanics feel fresh when combining them for platforming and reaching secret areas.  The gear system seems cool and there is crafting. The auto lockon feature is actually very useful.  There also seems to be quite a bit of customization even from early on in the game. No bugs thus far either which is always a plus. Also just here to give a thumbs up so more people can find and experience the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043215952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1693202392}
review: Through 5+ hours of gaming, I am happy to report that this is an extremely fun Souls-like Metroidvania. The pixel graphics set the scene for a fun and surprisingly deep romp through an expansive universe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040091082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1693236701}
review: Challenging but very rewarding and versatile. Arriving in the city was a great moment where the game really opened up. I love the different planets and how quickly you get stronger with upgrades. I've played for more than 10 hours now and I'm only 23% of the way through - very excited to continue and how it will evolve. Definetly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070454253', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1693078019}
review:
GINSHA erinnert mich etwas an Metroid Prime, nur etwas erweitert mit den speziellen Gravity Shield und Dash-Mechaniken. Man ist eine Art Klon und erkundet eine Welt aus 6 miteinander verbundenen Planeten. Herausfordernde K√§mpfe, mit RPG-Elementen und  Crafting-M√∂glichkeiten. Was auch sehr interessant ist, das  Karma-basierten Entscheidungs System. Man kann somit das Spiel quasi als guter oder b√∂ser Klon bestreiten. Ich denke deswegen bietet GINSHA bestimmt auch eine Wiederspielbarkeit. Man verf√ºgt √ºber einen Scanner, um Daten zu sammeln und Upgrades zu nutzen. 

Etliche Waffen, von denen ich bestimmt erst einen Bruchteil gefunden habe.

Die fetzige 80er-Sci-Fi-√Ñsthetik verleiht dem Spiel eine coolen  Cyberpunk Atmosph√§re.

Mir gef√§llt auch der 80er Soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073385931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1693152144}
review:
Loving the game, soundtrack is on point, beautiful atmosphere and pixel art is top notch. Definitely recommend this game! Reminds me of old school sci-fi and the guardians are not easy to beat! Once i got used to their patterns I got better. This is a breath of fresh air amidst the saturated market, kudos to the creators. Well done.

First part of gameplay here: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_0vi8oERRHw&ab_channel=GamingGatos

review: The pixel art is simply gorgeous. However, I am more confused than anything else, about the mechanics. But perhaps, it is by design. If you can handle difficult games, perhaps this is for you. It is not exactly for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088388166', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 527, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1692915035}
review:
I enjoy the cyberpunk-y vibes with this metroidvania title. Features soem very nice pixel art. It has a mix of  Souls and RPG mechanics. I haven't gotten too far into the game but from what I've played it has been clearly well crafted. Will definitely keep comin' back to this one.
